Description: The name of the Table that appears in Interface pull-down menus (visible in Designer worksheets).
The number of times this Interface is used (read-only).
The server URL used to invoke the Interface methods (these URLs don't need to be accessed outside the server).
Used to allow or deny Interface rights when writing data to the source (may not apply to all Interfaces).
The account user name required for authentication.
The account password required for authentication.
Used to allow or deny the Interface permission to write data to the source. May not apply to all Interfaces.
The Active Directory or local group that a user must belong to in order to write data to the source.
Allows for intelligent Trend data downsampling to preserve the Trend's shape. Some data sources (e.g. relational DBs) may return thousands of values, effectively overwhelming the display.
Controls where the error is displayed.
Controls how many values are retrieved in one call to the Interface. A smaller number may help with parallelism and can be adjusted for a slow-running Interface.
Controls whether or not data is retrieved via this Interface. If disabled, no data will be returned and an 'Interface Disabled' message will appear in all references.
